chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Operating While Revoked (Cause Great Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Angel Lara was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jose Angel Lara is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jose Angel Lara was found guilty of Knowingly Operating While Revoked (Cause Great Bodily Harm), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Defendant will not request early termination of Probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $65,277.70 over the course of probation. Defendant has 30 days to challenge restitution amount and request hearing.
-------------------
*AMENDMENT 10-18-2022  Judgment of Conviction amended pursuant to Stipulation and Order for Restitution filed on 9-28-22:
$29,998.78 to C.L.L.
$1,261.02 to D.L.L
----------------------------------------

Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
DOC COLLECT 
-------------------

No alcohol, drugs, or drug paraphernalia. Not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Not to drive without a valid license. 
-------------------
Must attend a Victim Impact Panel. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

timeConds.notes: The Defendant is to serve sixty (60) days in the Walworth County Jail with work release privileges to commence on or before October 25, 2022 @ 8:00 a.m. NOTE: The Defendant must report on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Failure to comply will result in revocation of work release privileges for a period of five (5) days unless reinstated by the Court.

charges.descr: Knowingly Operating While Revoked (Cause Great Bodily Harm)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose Angel Lara

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jose Angel Lara in court.  Attorney Andrew Walter in court for Jose Angel Lara.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have come to an agreement.  Defendant plead guilty to Count # 1. Upon motion of the State Counts # 2 and # 3 are dismissed and read-in. Court GRANTS motion. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Defendant does not make statement. Court gives WARNINGS regarding deportation, felon prohibited from firearm possession pursuant to Sec. 941.29, ineligibility to vote until civil rights restored, prohibition of child offender working with children pursuant to Sec. 948.13 and possession of body armor prohibited pursuant to Sec. 941.291.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jose Angel Lara in court.  Attorney Andrew Walter in court for Jose Angel Lara. Offer and discovery received by defense. Defense is requesting time to review offer with client. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Application for Jail Time Credit form
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

records.addlTxt:
2:27 PM (64-06) Defendant Jose Angel Lara in court.  Attorney Andrew Walter in court for Jose Angel Lara.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Walter acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.


Judge to be assigned, then set STC.
